Calendar

The 2019 Formula 1 season is contested over 21 Grand Prix held around the world. These include historic races such as the Monaco Grand Prix and the British Grand Prix but also new races such as the return of the French Grand Prix which was reintroduced in 2018.

In the 2020 season, the number of races will increase with the introduction of the Dutch Grand Prix and the Vietnam Grand Prix.

The next race is the 2019 Brazilian Grand Prix held in São Paulo, Brazil on the 17th of November.

Below is the full calendar of races for the 2019 Formula 1 season:

Drivers

Learn about the 20 drivers competing in the 2019 Formula 1 championship including Lewis Hamilton, the defending World Drivers' Champion, who is looking to win his 6th championship this year.

Teams

Find out more about the 10 teams competing for the World Constructors' Championship. Mercedes are the reigning champions, and they face fierce competition from the likes of Ferrari and Red Bull.
